results.title: Focus on downers
results.creator_credit: Noel Nosseck and American Educational Films
results.brief_description: Vignettes illustrate how barbiturates can lead to death when they cause the user to forget how many they have taken, when they are taken with alcohol or when the user attempts to drive. Questions use by young people, and discusses barbiturate withdrawal.

results.brief_description: Shows the picturesque quality of Canberra and the quiet beauty of the environment in which the nerve centre of Australia’s Federal Government is situated. Musical soundtrack, no spoken commentary.

results.title: Flying: a dream come true
results.brief_description: Shows gliding enthusiasts building their planes, their training and techniques. The Wasser-Kuppe Hill in the Rhoen mountains is a popular resort for gliders. The weightless flight, an old dream of man’s has persisted in spite of the innovation of the motor driven aircraft.

results.title: Flying veterinary service
results.brief_description: Describes the work of the flying veterinary service established at Broken Hill by the New South Wales Department of Agriculture. Stresses the importance of the service in the national economy. Shows the work of a veterinary officer as he attends to a case of sheep poisoning.

results.title: Flying the flag : the story of the Eureka flag
results.creator_credit: Jo Lane, Debra Annear and Vixen Films
results.brief_description: This production examines the events associated with the Eureka Stockade, which occurred at Ballarat, Victoria, on 3rd December 1854. The Eureka flag was unfurled by protesting diggers on Bakery Hill prior to the Stockade, a potent symbol of their fight for democracy and human rights in a new land. The issues investgated include the flag’s design, manufacture, conservation and the sometimes debatable uses made of it by political groups. This video draws in a wealth of material provided by the Ballarat Fine Art Gallery and the Public Record Office of Victoria, as well as interviews with a number of people directly associated with conserving and promoting the flag in the 20th century.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Jo Lane, Debra Annear and Vixen Films

results.title: Flying skis. [Fishing]
results.brief_description: 1. ‘Flying skis’ looks at ice-skating, figure skating and ski joring. The Scandinavian sport of ski joring combines the skills of a cowboy with those of a skier whereby skiers are towed behind a horse. Alex Foster, ex-Olympian skier, captain of the Canadian ski team and inventor of the tow rope and ski-lift, demonstrates the fancy skiing style that he developed which combines down-hill skiing and figure skating techniques. 2. ‘Fishing’ captures the thrill and excitement that lures anglers to fresh and saltwater fishing. Introduces a range of innovative techniques including fishing with dogs and donkeys, casting a line with the aid of a parachute, Georgian swamp fishing without equipment and catching Arkansaw monster Garfish. Also shows more conventional fishing methods including Silvery Salmon; Marlin fishing off the Australian coast and Tuna fishing in Nova Scotia.
